Definitions Documentation¶

class definitions.Component(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
center_of_gravity[source]¶

Location of the center of gravity w.r.t the origin

Returns:Location Tuple in SI meter
Return type:Point
component_type[source]¶

An identifier to be able to lump masses together. Possible entries: ‘wing’ ‘fuselage’ ‘vt’ ‘ht’ ‘ct’ ‘boom’ ‘payload’ ‘prop’ ‘battery’ ‘electronics’

Returns:Component Type
internal_shape[source]¶

The geometry of the component that will be placed inside a structure, (i.e in a wing or fuselage)

Return type:parapy.geom
text_label[source]¶

Automatically creates a text label that inherits whatever object is labelled as. This can be hidden through use of the Input parameter hide_labels

Return type:TextLabel
text_label_position[source]¶

Sets the default position of the text_label to be on the front-left corner of the internal_shape

Return type:Point
weight[source]¶

Total mass of the component

Returns:Mass in SI kilogram
Return type:float
class definitions.ExternalBody(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
external_shape[source]¶

The final shape of a ExternalSurface class which is to be exported THIS PART MUST BE OVERWRITTEN!!!

Returns:External Shape
Return type:Box
planform_area[source]¶

The projected area of an external_shape when looking at the XY plane in the nadir direction (z)

Returns:Projected Area on the XY plane in SI sq. meter
Return type:float
surface_type[source]¶

An identifier to be able to lump areas together. Possible entries: ‘wing’ ‘fuselage’ ‘vt’ ‘ht’ ‘ct’ ‘boom’

Returns:Component Type
weight[source]¶

Total mass of the component

Returns:Mass in SI kilogram
Return type:float
wetted_area[source]¶

Returns the total wetted area of the external_part to be able to perform drag and weight estimations

Returns:Total wetted area of the external_part in SI sq. meter
Return type:float
